results.title: Friend of sinners
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus of Nazareth from: the shame of Mary Magdalene; the Rich Young Man approaches Jesus; the miracle of the loaves and the fishes; Zealots and Judas discuss the work of Jesus; Simon the Zealot follows Jesus; in the house of Simon the Pharisee; Joseph of Arimathea converses with Jesus; Mary Magdelene washes Jesus’ feet with her hair, Jesus forgives her sins.

results.title: Friend and foe
results.creator_credit: Philip Owtram, Antony Barrier and Antony Barrier Productions
results.brief_description: Intended for dog handlers, the film shows how to reach a perfect understanding with a particular dog by developing its latent natural instincts, yet obeying every command.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions, Electric Shadow Productions, ACT III Communications and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports Evelyn back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to separate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: Friday the 13th
results.creator_credit: Sean S. Cunningham and Georgetown productions
results.brief_description: At last count Friday the 13th is about to embark into its tenth sequel (it also spun off briefly into a television series) a dubious achievement for a film which was essentially a cheap imitation of John Carpenter’s seminal slasher film Halloween (1978). It also inspired a series of horror films set around commemorative and public holidays (Mothers day, My bloody valentine, April fool’s day, Silent night, deadly night etc..) and launched the careers of Kevin Bacon and horror make-up artist Tom Savini. This however is where all the slasher rules and cliches began. Starting off in 1958, two teenage camp counselors are brutally murdered by an unknown assailant at Camp Crystal lake. Flashing forward 20 years on and a new group of counselors have ascended onto the camp, affectionately dubbed by the wary locals as ‘Camp blood’. Soon enough the body count begins to pile up as the horny teens get dispatched in various gruesome scenarios, all the while ignoring the blatent signs that this is not a good place to be. Cast includes Betsy Palmer, Adrienne King, Harry Crosby, Laurie Bartram, Mark Nelson, Jeannine Taylor, Robbi Morgan

results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Julie Taymor, Roberto Sneider, Lindsay Flickinger, Nancy Hardin, Lizz Speed, Joy Polstein, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Ventanarosa Productions and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Khalo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.

results.title: Friction
results.creator_credit: Dennis Ward, Esso and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Part of the Advanced science series. Demonstrates the basic laws of friction: first, that friction is independent of surface area; and second, that it is proportional to load.
